The breaking changes are detailed in the Recipe
, but can be summarized as follows:
Recipe's peer dependency on Emotion has been updated from v9 to v10.
EzLink and EzField now support React.ForwardRef instead of
. You will need to upgrade React Router to at least v5.1 if your application passes refs to EzLink and uses EzLink's

Recipe's analytics bookmarklet tool has been updated to support emotion 10. If you wish to be able to run analytics against emotion 9 based applications, you should retain your current bookmarklet link and install the new analytics tool as a separate bookmark.
While the emotion team have provided a
for upgrading emotion, to minimize the effort for teams to upgrade, a more detailed step-by-step is provided below.
The Recipe team recommends committing to git between each migration step, to make the code-review process easier to follow.
In order to install Recipe v10 in downstream applications, applications must also update their installation of Emotion to v10.
Conversely, applications that use Recipe version 8 or lower today that wish to update from Emotion v9 to v10 must also update Recipe to v10.

Applications may require significant changes as part of the Emotion upgrade. Some of these steps can be automated with tooling provided by the emotion team, other steps require some manual intervention.
If your application is NOT using create-react-app, you may need to update your installation of
If your application uses server rendering, you should install
, which will need to be configured in order to support Recipe. Instructions on how to configure
The emotion team have provided some basic tooling to update emotion v9 imports to use the newer emotion v10 packages. This tooling is packaged up as a
and should have been installed during the previous installation step.

You should then configure the specific
you wish to include by adding to the rules section of the eslint configuration.

is to tell eslint to include JSX files and TypeScript files when linting.

+ import styled from '@emotion/styled';

children.value: Remove css helper usage of className
This is the most significant change in emotion v10, and typically requires the most intervention; Emotion 10 doesn't let you easily access the underlying class name for any of its generated styles.
For example, in Emotion 9, you might have had two classes from
and composed them together with a styled component, manually joined their string values, or passed the classNames to a third-party component:
helper returns a style object that can only be used by either emotion's

and inspect the usage for the patterns above, replacing any usage that relies on className string values.

children.value: Replacing innerRef with native ref prop
Styled components created by emotion now support native
, allowing parent components to access a reference to the styled dom element of the child component.
While emotion 10 continues to support the
prop, which previously was used to provide this behavior, emotion now triggers a warning that the
To avoid these warnings, do a global find/replace for
Please note: take care when performing this find/replace step to ensure the

prop was being passed to a styled component, and not to another component library, such as react-router. It is recommended that you upgrade react-router to at least version 5.1 (which supports ref forwarding), so that you can consistently use
Now we're server rendering using the emotion cache (which on the server is configured to support the full set of CSS selectors, such as nth child).
Emotion 10 needs to be configured to allow usage of the full set of CSS selectors, such as
, when running in a browser. In order to do this, we need to tell emotion's styles cache to run in compatibility mode. If you do not implement this step, you

If your application does not need to support IE11, you can skip this step.
, applications that need to support IE11 were instructed to install
Disabling speedy in emotion 10 is now achieved via a new API on emotion's cache.
In the entry point for your client application (likely
for apps created with create-react-app, or
in server rendered apps), provide the option

- const cache = createCache();
+ const cache = createCache({speedy: false});
Optionally, you can conditionally disable speedy only for IE11 only as follows:

const isIE11 = typeof window !== `undefined` && !!window.MSInputMethodContext &
const cache = createCache({speedy: !isIE11});
Now remove the usage of the prior API for disabling speedy:

prop, you will need to upgrade React Router to at least v5.1 for the ref to continue to behave correctly.

children.value: Why am I'm seeing type errors accessing theme values?
The Emotion has been iterating on their support for TypeScript and have been improving their type definitions.
If you start to see type errors when accessing theme values, you may wish to provide explicit type information for your props to provide type support, or explicitly cast the props as the

properties.ariaLabel: why am i getting the warning the pseudo class unsafepseudoclass is potentially unsafe when doing server side rendering permalink

children.value: Why am I getting the warning: The pseudo class "${unsafePseudoClass}" is potentially unsafe when doing server-side rendering?
Emotion 10 supports a new zero-config server-side rendering mode, however, this mode also causes a subset of pseudo class selectors to

In an effort to identify CSS selectors that are not supported in the mode, emotion logs a warning message when a subset of those selectors are used. This message can be misleading, since it can occur in environments that are not utilizing server-rendering.
If you see this messsage, please double check that you have set
. Compatibility mode should suppress this warning message.

refactor: Updated EzLayout to use flexbox gap for layout (where available), or
refactor: Added feature detection as part of
to facilitate css-based fallbacks for browser features.
fix: card size should not be inherited by nested cards
fix: Quiet cards should respect size prop if provided.
workflow: Updated visual regression environment for Chrome to use v91 (upgraded from v79).
workflow: added changesets to automate semver tracking and releases.
fix: search input overflows bounds of the EzLayout container. Closes
docs: switch doc-site examples to use playroom
Added playroom links to examples in docs.
Added a toggle to examples for toggling between example code and preview.
instructions, since it's now part of
Moved doc-site svgs to sprites for carousel and timeline examples to reduce the size of the example code.
Refactored carousel example to map over data to reduce the size of the example code.
fix: Server rendering of checkboxes and labels will no longer render
fix: apply range media queries to
(instead of max-width queries), to avoid SSR order-of-insertion issues.
workflow: Added custom format for changeset generated changelog
to horizontally collapse instead of filling the width of the parent element. Closes
(which isn't built with es5 compatible syntax).
